abstracts.cdata!:
The Rio Grande Do Sul State Reform Loan
            Project's outcome was rated as satisfactory. Some of
            the key lessons include: 1) Sub-national governments are key
            elements within the framework of a country's overall
            reform program. 2) Potential windows of opportunity for
            reform should be capitalized. 3) For the reforms to be
            sustainable, a consistent system of incentives has to be in
            place at the national level. 4) An adequate regulatory
            framework at the federal level is a pre-requisite for the
            successful implementation of state-level privatization and
            concession programs. 5) Focus on those sub-national
            governments that are most willing and able to implement
            major reforms. 6) Operations should concentrate on a few,
            significant reforms that are hard to reverse. 7)
            Quick-disbursing loans supporting a well-defined set of
            reforms can be effective tools in promoting structural
            adjustment at the sub-national level. 8) Reform loans should
            support the state's own reform program, thus maximizing
            the state's ownership of the project. 9) Despite the
            irreversibility of privatization reforms, the project raises
            the question on whether greater consensus can be achieved
            with respect to these reforms. 10) The Bank should require
            the actual sale of public enterprises as a condition for
            disbursement. 11) Governments should be encouraged to ensure
            that the composition of the regulatory agencies is
            politically balanced.
